# Motivation 

- *Proof-Based Math Readings* is a free and independent online reading group where we study mathematics required in economics master's/PhD programs using an intuitive approach.
- This session of the reading group is on *Matrix Algebra*.

# Prerequisites

- CGPA: 3.00/4.00
- [\faBook Book of Proof - Richard Hammack (3.3 Edition, 2022)](https://www.people.vcu.edu/~rhammack/BookOfProof/)
- [\faYoutube Linear Algebra - Gilbert Strang (2005)](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLE7DDD91010BC51F8)
- Please use the [\faLink Application Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf3OxwYuAwiDXMVTCQ_x3FTtKnHmRRkl_SXlpdfqTDty06PxQ/viewform) to join our reading group anytime.
- Applicants are informed about their application results within a week via email.

# Format

- This session takes 12 weeks.
- We discuss the topics/exercises that we struggle with at [\faDiscord Proof-Based Math Readings \[Discord\]](https://discord.com).
- We do not have face-to-face/online meetings due to the size of the group.
- Members are expected to read the chapters from the book.

# Resources

## Main Book

**Matrix Algebra - Karim M. Abadir, Jan R. Magnus (2005)** is our main book because it is well-structured and well-written. It also provides detailed solutions for exercises in the book.

\begin{itemize}
  \item[\faBook] Matrix Algebra - Karim M. Abadir, Jan R. Magnus (2005)
  \item[\faBook] \href{https://www.janmagnus.nl/misc/corrections03.pdf}{Matrix Algebra - Karim M. Abadir, Jan R. Magnus (2005, Errata)}
\end{itemize}

## Supplementary

### Matrix Algebra

\begin{itemize}
  \item[\faBook] Matrix Differential Calculus with Applications in Statistics and Econometrics - Jan R. Magnus, Heinz Neudecker (3rd Edition, 2019)
  \item[\faBook] \href{https://media.pearsoncmg.com/ph/bp/bridgepages/bp_greene_bridgepage/Econometric_Analysis_8/Greene_Appendices.pdf}{Econometric Theory - William H. Greene (\textbf{Appendix A}, 8th Edition, 2020)}
\end{itemize}

### Proof

\begin{itemize}
  \item[\faBook] \href{https://www.people.vcu.edu/~rhammack/BookOfProof/}{Book of Proof - Richard Hammack (3.3 Edition, 2022)}
  \item[\faYoutube] \href{https://www.youtube.com/@jeremy9959/playlists?view=50&sort=dd&shelf_id=5}{Book of Proof - Richard Hammack (3.3 Edition, 2022, Companion playlist by Jeremy Teitelbaum)}
  \item[\faYoutube] \href{https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVMgvCDIRy1x00m7Oo9XzEkDDACeEK_m-}{Book of Proof - Richard Hammack (3.3 Edition, 2022, Companion playlist by Michael Penn)}
\end{itemize}

# Reading Schedule

- **MA** is the abbreviation of **Matrix Algebra - Karim M. Abadir, Jan R. Magnus (2005)**.
  
::: {.callout-tip icon=false}
## **\faBook MA \hfill Week 01 \faCalendar* **

\begin{itemize}
  \item[] Appendix A: Some mathematical tools
  \item[] Appendix B: Notation
  \item[] Chapter 1: Vectors
  \item[] Chapter 2: Matrices
  
\end{itemize}
:::

::: {.callout-tip icon=false}
## **\faBook MA \hfill Week 02 \faCalendar* **

\begin{itemize}
  \item[] Chapter 3: Vector spaces
  \item[] Chapter 4: Rank, inverse, and determinant
\end{itemize}
:::

::: {.callout-tip icon=false}
## **\faBook MA \hfill Week 03-04 \faCalendar* **

\begin{itemize}
  \item[] Chapter 5: Partitioned matrices
  \item[] Chapter 6: Systems of equations
\end{itemize}
:::

::: {.callout-tip icon=false}
## **\faBook MA \hfill Week 05-06 \faCalendar* **

\begin{itemize}
  \item[] Chapter 7: Eigenvalues, eigenvectors, and factorizations
  \item[] Chapter 8: Positive (semi)definite and idempotent matrices
\end{itemize}
:::

::: {.callout-tip icon=false}
## **\faBook MA \hfill Week 07-08-09 \faCalendar* **

\begin{itemize}
  \item[] Chapter 10: Kronecker product, vec-operator, and Moore-Penrose inverse
  \item[] Chapter 11: Patterned matrices: commutation- and duplication matrix
\end{itemize}
:::

::: {.callout-tip icon=false}
## **\faBook MA \hfill Week 10-11-12 \faCalendar* **

\begin{itemize}
  \item[] Chapter 12: Matrix inequalities
  \item[] Chapter 13: Matrix calculus
\end{itemize}
:::
